wikipedia_page.main: Maxim Anderson (25 April 1914 in London, England – 10 July 1959) was a British director and producer of documentaries. He worked with the GPO Film Unit from 1936 onwards, and later changed to Crown Film Unit. He directed documentaries such as The Harvest Shall Come (1942) and Four Men in Prison (1950).

response: * Four Men in Prison (dir. Max Anderson 1950)

*Max Anderson (American football) (born 1945), American football running back and kick returner

The Harvest Shall Come is a 1942 British documentary film about agricultural work between 1900 and World War II, using the story of a farm laborer to illustrate the importance of agriculture, and the importance of supporting workers in this occupation. The film, produced by Basil Wright and directed by Max Anderson, was well received.
It praised Max Anderson as one of the best documentary makers to appear for many years and called John Slater "an outstanding interpreter of working class character."
Four Men In Prison is a 1950 documentary film about English prison conditions directed by Max Anderson.
John Grierson was the producer and the film was directed by Max Anderson.
